repastcity3.environment
Class SpatialIndexManager

java.lang.Object
  repastcity3.environment.SpatialIndexManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cacheable
public abstract class SpatialIndexManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements Cacheable

Class that can be used to hold spatial indexes for Geography Projections. This allows for more efficient GIS operations (e.g. finding nearby objects). The inner Index class is used to actually hold the index.

Author:
Nick Malleson
See Also:
SpatialIndex, STRtree

public static <T> void createIndex(repast.simphony.space.gis.Geography<T> geog,
                                   java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
Create a new spatial index for the given geography Geography.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of object stored in the geography.
Parameters:
geog -
clazz - The class of the objects that are being stored in the geography.

findNearestObject

public static <T> T findNearestObject(repast.simphony.space.gis.Geography<T> geog,
                                      com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate x,
                                      java.util.List<com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate> closestPoints,
                                      GlobalVars.GEOGRAPHY_PARAMS.BUFFER_DISTANCE searchDist)
                           throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
Find the nearest object in the given geography to the coordinate.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of object that will be returned.
Parameters:
x - The coordinate to search around
geography - The given geography to look through
closestPoints - An optional List that will be populated with the closest points to x (i.e. the results of distanceOp.closestPoints().
Returns:
The nearest object.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - If there is no spatial index for the given geography.

search

public static <T> java.util.List<T> search(repast.simphony.space.gis.Geography<T> geog,
                                           com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Geometry geom)
                                throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
Search for objects located at the given coordinate. This uses the query() function of the underlying spatial index so might return objects that are close two, but do not interesect, the coordinate.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of object that will be returned.
Parameters:
x - The coordinate to search around
geography - The given geography to look through
Returns:
The objects that intersect the coordinate (or are close to it) or an empty list if none could be found.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - If there is no spatial index for the given geography.
See Also:
STRtree

hasIndex

public static boolean hasIndex(repast.simphony.space.gis.Geography<?> geog)
Find out whether or not this SpatialIndexManager has an index for the given geography.
